title.rendered: Bridger Anderson: Net Worth 2023, Career Earnings

content.rendered:
Summary

  • About Bridger Anderson
    • Early Career
    • Professional Career
  • Bridger Anderson’s Net Worth in 2023
    • Career Earnings
  • Personal Details
    • Girlfriend
    • How old is he?
    • How tall is he?
    • What is his nationality?
    • Career Highlights
    • FAQs About Bridger Anderson 

Bridger Anderson is a professional rodeo contestant specializing in steer wrestling. Born and raised in Carrington, North Dakota, Anderson grew up in a family deeply involved in rodeo.

In 2020, at the age of 22, Anderson became one of the youngest to qualify for the National Finals Rodeo (NFR), often referred to as the “Super Bowl of rodeo”.

Here you can follow Bridger Anderson’s net worth, career earnings, career, biography, achievements, relationship status, and more.

About Bridger Anderson

Bridger Anderson hails from Carrington, North Dakota, a small town that nurtured his love for the western lifestyle from a young age. His parents, Glenn and Robin, who owned a ranch, instilled in him the values of kindness and respect.

Anderson has two younger siblings and was heavily influenced by his family’s horsemanship and roping skills.

From a young age, Anderson showed a keen interest in rodeo, specifically steer wrestling. At the age of three, he watched the National Finals Rodeo (NFR) on television and expressed his desire to become a professional steer wrestler. His parents supported his passion, and he spent a significant amount of time honing his skills and learning the ropes of the sport.

Early Career

Anderson’s early career in rodeo began in junior high, progressing to high school rodeo where he won the state steer wrestling title twice.

He also competed in wrestling, winning a state championship in 2015, which contributed to his athletic ability and strength, key requirements for a successful steer wrestler.

Professional Career

Bridger Anderson is a professional steer wrestler who has made significant strides in his career.

Anderson attended Northwestern Oklahoma State University, where he was under the guidance of rodeo coach Stockton Graves. During his time at the university, he qualified for the College National Finals Rodeo (CNFR) in steer wrestling multiple times, even winning a college title in 2019.

In 2017, Anderson joined the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association (PRCA). He qualified for his first National Finals Rodeo (NFR) in 2020, finishing No. 10 in the World Standings.

In 2023, Anderson won several major regular-season rodeos, including Rodeo Houston, Red Bluff (California) Round-Up, Cody (Wyoming) Stampede, and Pendleton (Oregon) Round-Up.

As of November 2023, Anderson ranked 14th in the PRCA World standings, with season earnings of $85,510.84.

Bridger Anderson’s Net Worth in 2023

As of 2023, Bridger Anderson’s net worth is estimated to be $1 million.

His earnings from the regular season in 2023 amounted to $85,511.

Career Earnings

Anderson’s career earnings primarily come from his winnings in various rodeo competitions. In 2023, he earned significant amounts from major wins at Rodeo Houston ($13,250), Red Bluff Round-Up ($7,870), Cody Stampede ($5,749), and Pendleton Round-Up ($6,562).

He has accumulated a career earnings of $278,516. He has earned $85,511 in PRCA earnings.

Personal Details

Girlfriend

Steer wrestler Anderson appears to be single. He is focused on his career.

How old is he?

He is 25 years old, as of November 2023.

How tall is he?

He stands at 6 ft 2 inches tall.

What is his nationality?

He is American.

Career Highlights

  • Career earnings: $278,516
  • 2022 world standings place: 21st
  • 2022 earnings: $62,368
  • Education: Northwestern Oklahoma State University in Alva
  • Wrangler NFR Qualifications: 1 (2020)

2023 Highlights

• Won the High Desert Stampede (Redmond, Ore.)

• Won the Red Bluff (Calif.) Round-Up

• Won the Gold County Pro Rodeo (Auburn, Calif.)

• Won the Parker County Sheriff’s Posse Frontier Days And PRCA Rodeo (Weatherford, Texas)

• Won the Wing & Barrel Western Days (Sonoma, Calif.)

FAQs About Bridger Anderson 

What is Bridger Anderson’s net worth?

$1 million as of 2023.

How tall is he?

6 ft 2 inches.

When did he join PRCA?

2017.
